image.altText: Oliver sits and smiles, holding his saxaphone.

props.synopsis: Plans to overhaul the 60-year-old ANU School of Music, including dropping one-on-one instrument lessons, have been met with shock and dismay by students and former staff.

title.children: 'Defies any logic': Staff, students react to ANU School of Music plan

image.altText: The flyover shows what the intersection would look like with light rail passing through the middle, with traffic lights.

props.synopsis: Designs released by the ACT government show how they intend to reconstruct a key roundabout in Canberra's south, as they call for public feedback.

title.children: New vision shows how Canberra light rail would transform key roundabout

image.altText: Tam Goddard

props.synopsis: Pet owners would be legally required to spend a minimum of three hours with their dog every day under the proposed laws, but questions remain about how such laws would be enforced.

title.children: Should the government tell you how long to spend with your dog?

image.altText: Smooch

props.synopsis: Smooch the cat's owners felt a golf-ball sized lump under her skin while giving their pet a cuddle. It saved her life.

title.children: Stick 17.5cm long found in cat’s stomach with no entry or exit wound

image.altText: Concept art of a sports club.

props.synopsis: The Viking Group wanted to build a $33 million club in a region with the highest rate of gambling losses per person in NSW outside of greater Sydney. Many in the community had other ideas.

title.children: 160 pokies, 50m from houses, open until 3am: New club’s plan rejected

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court heard police found hundreds of child abuse images on the 57-year-old's devices, as well as a document titled The Paedophile's Handbook.

title.children: 'Vile and pernicious': Grandfather jailed for sexually abusing 2yo

image.altText: Youth welfare professional answers questions in office setting.

props.synopsis: The ACT Children and Young People Commissioner says including the ACT's continuous monitoring system in nationally consistent Working With Children Checks could improve child safety in childcare centres.

title.children: This ACT child safety practice could help improve national ones

image.altText: Reserve Bank sign overlaid with inflation chart

props.synopsis: The RBA board holds interest rates at 3.85 per cent in a split decision, six votes to three. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA holds interest rates at 3.85 per cent in shock decision

image.altText: Sliding glass doors into a building with the words Reserve Bank of Australia written above.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank had been expected to cut the cash rate to 3.6 per cent, its lowest since April 2023, but instead left it on hold at its July meeting.

title.children: Breaking: RBA defies expectations of interest rate cut in split decision

image.altText: A plate with a smattering of green beans and beef Wellington, and a knife and fork.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, Erin Patterson was a mother of two from a regional town who lived a quiet life. Now, the 50-year-old has been found guilty of murdering three people with death cap mushrooms, in a trial that's made global headlines.

title.children: How a recipe of 'ultimate indulgence' became central to a murder plot

image.altText: A young woman with blonde hair and brown eyes smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: In New South Wales, just 7 per cent of sexual assault cases reported to police resulted in a conviction. Lily's story offers an insight into how the system treats victim-survivors.

title.children: Lily's friends shunned her after she was raped. She went to court anyway, and won

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair in a hospital with an IV in her arm, which rests on a pillor. She is looking down at her phone.

props.synopsis: There are ways to change the steep cancer trajectories that gen X and millennials might be on.

title.children: If we're to stop the rise in under 50s getting cancer, things need to change

image.altText: A group of people pose for a photo, all are blurred except for Erin Scutter in the front row, wearing a pink top.

props.synopsis: The world has met Erin Patterson as the murderous cook behind a mushroom meal that killed three relatives. But years before her courtroom infamy, the woman from Melbourne's suburbs divided opinions.

title.children: 'She's no dope': Who is the host of Australia's most infamous lunch?

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: The federal government's economic think tank says Australia will likely be a winner from Donald Trump's tariffs if it does not retaliate and that we would be better off by removing more of the nation's remaining tariffs.

title.children: Trump's tariffs 'actually good' for Australia, Productivity Commission finds

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with smashed glass doors and a sign that says Miznon at night time.

props.synopsis: Three people have been charged with assault, riotous behaviour and criminal damage after a group of protesters converged on an Israeli-owned restaurant in Melbourne's CBD on Friday night.

title.children: Three protesters charged over incident at Israeli restaurant in Melbourne

image.altText: Four people searching debris on the banks of a river. Debris is littered throughout tree branches.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump describes the catastrophic Texas floods as a one-in-100-year event — a disaster "nobody expected". But a political debate is raging over whether cuts to the public service have played a role.

title.children: Were the Texas floods a disaster 'nobody expected' — or an avoidable catastrophe?

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: Data shows the shortfall of construction workers in Queensland is forecast to peak in Queensland next year as work begins for the Olympic Games.

title.children: Queensland facing 54,000 construction worker shortfall ahead of Olympics

image.altText: Hannah Beazley looks to the left of frame with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The entire Nedlands council will be sacked and be replaced by three commissioners after four councillors resigned within hours of each other on Monday.

title.children: City of Nedlands council to be sacked, replaced by three commissioners

image.altText: benjamin netanyahu hands donald trump a note across a dining table

props.synopsis: The Israeli prime minister is expected to spend several days in Washington as Israeli and Hamas representatives take part in ceasefire negotiations in Qatar.

title.children: A Nobel Peace Prize and Gaza: What Trump and Netanyahu discussed at dinner

image.altText: Woman getting breast cancer screening done

props.synopsis: Eligibility for some cancer screening programs has recently been expanded to reflect the increasing cancer rates among younger Australians, while other programs have just rolled out this month. Here's what to know.

title.children: What your eligibility is for Australia's free cancer screening programs

image.altText: A woman with blonde long-hair, wearing pale framed glasses, holding a white folder, leaf pattern dress standing outside

props.synopsis: In her 683-page report, Coroner Elisabeth Armitage made 32 formal recommendations for change, after an almost three-year coronial inquest into the police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker. Here are five of the key findings.

title.children: Five key takeaways from the 683-page report into Kumanjayi Walker's death

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: Kids face down asleep in hoodies, electrical sockets exposed and one child locked in a shed. Documents reveal disturbing revelations from inside Australia's childcare sector in crisis.

title.children: Documents reveal shocking practices inside childcare sector in crisis

image.altText: Men in dark uniforms stand on a parapet surrounded by razor wire at a prison.

props.synopsis: A NSW coroner says it is "extraordinary" that a "young, vulnerable" man who feared for his safety was left alone for a lengthy period before his death in 2022.

title.children: Inmate's death after 18 hours of solitude 'unnecessary', coroner finds

image.altText: A man sitting on a couch with a baby and his son

props.synopsis: Not having family support, having children with disabilities, and inflexible working arrangements make the school holiday juggle difficult for these working parents.

title.children: Readers share how they navigate school holidays as working parents

image.altText: a stone archway in a paddock with the bright lights of the aurora behind it

props.synopsis: On the side of Tasmania's main highway is a relic of Horton College, one of early colonial Australia's most elite schools.

title.children: This arch is a Tassie landmark, a relic of a prestigious boys' school

image.altText: Hand holding a folded up piece of paper, police sign in the distance

props.synopsis: Via a deed of settlement and release, Revenue NSW tried to stop complaints being made to the ombudsman and ICAC, despite taxpayers having a statutory right to complain to integrity agencies.

title.children: Agency caught using contract to muzzle complaints to corruption watchdog

image.altText: A older man in a black jacket

props.synopsis: A zookeeper who applied a makeshift tourniquet has been credited with preventing a tragedy after the attack at Darling Downs Zoo.

title.children: Zoo owner says quick thinking after lion attack saved woman's life

image.altText: a man on a horse chases a cow.

props.synopsis: Authorities are urging horse owners to vaccinate against the virus but organisers of Queensland’s two biggest equestrian sports — racing and campdrafting — say the latest detection is unlikely to disrupt popular events.

title.children: Equestrian events to continue despite latest Hendra case

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: South Australian commercial fishers can apply to have licence and other government fees waived if their catches have been impacted by the state's toxic algal bloom, which has now spread to the Port River.

title.children: Fishing sector to have fees waived amid algal bloom, which has now spread to Port River

image.altText: A side-profile picture of a man in a dark suit.

props.synopsis: Former Gold Coast City councillor Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden is to stand trial in the Brisbane Supreme Court over the alleged murder in the family home in 2023.

title.children: Accused killer ex-councillor choked stepfather in kitchen, court hears

image.altText: Sarah Beaman

props.synopsis: The union says the action is not about "nurses buying Gucci handbags", but rather maintaining nation-leading wages and conditions.

title.children: Queensland nurses refuse to make beds as strike action ramps up

image.altText: Profile shot of man with grey hair, a brunette woman facing him and holding his face in both her hands

props.synopsis: Made as a way to cope with grief over losing his wife, legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg's latest movie looks at what happens when technology intrudes on the very human matter of death.

title.children: Legendary 81yo filmmaker processes his grief through haunting tech horror

image.altText: Matt Cameron smiles behind the drumkit against an orange stage backrdop

props.synopsis: Pearl Jam bids farewell to their drummer Matt Cameron, who quits after 27 years with the group: "Forever our friend in art and music."

title.children: Pearl Jam drummer Matt Cameron quits band

image.altText: A Crown building with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Crown Perth is handed a lifeline by the state government and will keep its gaming licence without penalty or conditions, three years after a royal commission found it unfit to hold a licence in WA.

title.children: WA government rules Crown fit to operate Perth casino without penalties

image.altText: Aboriginal man with cropped hair and goatee reading a book with the words Yes I can, other people in background.

props.synopsis: A program improving literacy rates among Indigenous adults helps more than 500 people change their lives, but advocates say much more is needed to address the problem nationally.

title.children: Adults return to the classroom to turn around literacy rates and lives
